definition: see 老頭子|老头子[lao3 tou2 zi5]

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc

sentences.english: A weak small spare old man.
The old man looked meditatively at the darts board.
sentences.chinese: 老头儿沉思不语，看着那投镖板。

sentences.english: "Light your lanthorn, old man, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “老头儿，把你的灯笼点亮，”他说。

sentences.english: Run for the doctor,the old man is dying.
sentences.chinese: 这个老头儿不行了，赶快去找医生。

sentences.english: What is your name, old man?
A sudden splash of water frightened the old man.
sentences.chinese: 忽听哗啦一声水响，老头儿吓了一大跳。

sentences.english: Gee- I sure wish that old guy who lives next door would buy himself a hearing aid.
sentences.chinese: 嗨，我真希望隔壁那老头儿能给本身买个助听器。

sentences.english: Judiao seeing this old man on the knifing, and dragons were quick to jump lotus pond.
sentences.chinese: 老头儿见状举刀就砍，小龙连忙跃人荷花池中。

sentences.english: I would have given ten years of my life to have been in that old man's shoes.
sentences.chinese: 我真情愿少活十年来换得这个老头儿的位置。

sentences.english: Poor old man, I didn't think he had any tears left.
sentences.chinese: 可怜的老头儿，我没料到他还有眼泪。

sentences.english: On these fifteen hundred francs these two old women and the old man subsisted.
sentences.chinese: 两个老妇人和老头儿都在那一千五百法郎里过活。

sentences.english: The young man took the clock happily and thanked the old man.
sentences.chinese: 年轻人很高兴地拿了闹钟，谢了老头儿。

sentences.english: That old man is rather surly.
He told him where the old man, Anselmo, was posted.
sentences.chinese: 他告诉他老头儿安塞尔莫放哨的地方。

sentences.english: Once the old man to the sea and fishnet.
sentences.chinese: 有一次老头儿向大海撒下鱼网。

sentences.english: My father's bark is worse than his bite.
sentences.chinese: 我家老头儿吠得比咬得更凶。

definition: (coll.) old man/(said of an aging husband) my old man
variant of 老家伙[lao3 jia1 huo5]
polite term for old woman or man
(literary) youngster/(old) young fellow (term of address used by the older generation)/(old) I, me (used in speaking to one's elders)
(derog.) old but still alive/old fart/old bastard
elder brother (often used self-referentially)/(form of address between male friends) old chap/buddy
